problem_prompt: Solve the following problem. An eight-digit integer is formed by repeating a positive four-digit integer. For example, 25,632,563 or 60,786,078 are integers of this form. What is the greatest common divisor of all eight-digit integers of this form?
solution: If the repeated four-digit integer is $n$, then the eight-digit integer is $10^4n+n=10001n$. So all numbers in this form share the factor 10001. Consider $10001\cdot1000$ and $10001\cdot1001$. After dividing out the factor 10001, 1000 and 1001 share no nontrivial factors, so the greatest common divisor must be exactly $\boxed{10001}$.
gpt_response:
Let the four-digit integer be denoted by abcd. Then, the eight-digit integer formed by repeating abcd is 10000abcd + abcd = 10001abcd.

Since the four-digit integer is a factor of the eight-digit integer, the greatest common divisor (GCD) of all eight-digit integers of this form will be equal to the GCD of all numbers of the form 10001abcd.

Note that 10001 is a prime number, so the GCD of all numbers of the form 10001abcd will be 10001.

Therefore, the greatest common divisor of all eight-digit integers of the given form is 10001.
solution_prompt:

Since the four-digit integer is a factor of the eight-digit integer, the greatest common divisor (GCD) of all eight-digit integers of this form will be equal to the GCD of all numbers of the form 10001abcd.

Note that 10001 is a prime number, so the GCD of all numbers of the form 10001abcd will be 10001.

Therefore, the greatest common divisor of all eight-digit integers of the given form is 10001.
